private_information: You specialize in organizing informal action descriptions into a clear, normalized domain specification.
Do not write PDDL; instead, extract and normalize entities: predicates, action parameters, preconditions, add effects, and delete effects.
Unify action and predicate names to lowercase (paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted; predicates: hand, cats, texture, sneeze, stupendous, spring, next, vase, collect).
Identify all object symbols mentioned (object_0, object_1, ...), but do not invent new ones.
spec_curator.goal: Deliver a normalized domain specification that faithfully captures the actions and predicates from the public description without emitting PDDL.

private_information: You focus on the first STATEMENT, which includes initial conditions, a goal, and a concrete plan.
Do not write PDDL. Extract: the set of objects used, the full list of initial facts, the goal, and the ordered plan as given.
If useful, you may note which action preconditions appear to be supported by the given initial state and earlier steps, but do not transform into PDDL.
instance_A_analyst.goal: Produce a clean, structured extraction of Instance A (initial facts, goal, and provided plan) for downstream synthesis.

private_information: You focus on the second STATEMENT, which includes initial conditions and a goal but no plan.
Do not write PDDL. Extract: the set of objects used, the full list of initial facts, and the goal.
Do not propose a plan; simply ensure the extraction is complete and precise.
instance_B_analyst.goal: Produce a clean, structured extraction of Instance B (initial facts and goal) for downstream synthesis.

private_information: You coordinate the other agents' outputs and produce the final planning artifacts.
You must emit a valid PDDL domain and PDDL problem files compatible with the Fast Downward solver.
Use lowercase names for actions and predicates. Use STRIPS-compatible constructs, with only predicates, preconditions, and add/delete effects.
Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and each problem between <problem></problem> tags.
Ensure that the problems include all required objects, the full init facts, and the goal from the extracted instances. Preserve the given semantics of actions as described.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the normalized domain and the two instance extractions and produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem files suitable for Fast Downward.

public_information: Domain overview: You can manipulate a set of symbolic objects with six actions: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted.
Predicates (all lowercase): hand(x), cats(x), texture(x), sneeze(x), stupendous(x), spring(x), next(x,y), vase(x,y), collect(x,y).
Action schema paltry(o0, o1, o2): preconditions: hand(o0) and cats(o1) and texture(o2) and vase(o0,o1) and next(o1,o2); add effects: next(o0,o2); delete effects: vase(o0,o1).
Action schema sip(o0, o1, o2): preconditions: hand(o0) and cats(o1) and texture(o2) and next(o0,o2) and next(o1,o2); add effects: vase(o0,o1); delete effects: next(o0,o2).
Action schema clip(o0, o1, o2): preconditions: hand(o0) and sneeze(o1) and texture(o2) and next(o1,o2) and next(o0,o2); add effects: vase(o0,o1); delete effects: next(o0,o2).

Action schema wretched(o0, o1, o2, o3): preconditions: sneeze(o0) and texture(o1) and texture(o2) and stupendous(o3) and next(o0,o1) and collect(o1,o3) and collect(o2,o3); add effects: next(o0,o2); delete effects: next(o0,o1).
Action schema memory(o0, o1, o2): preconditions: cats(o0) and spring(o1) and spring(o2) and next(o0,o1); add effects: next(o0,o2); delete effects: next(o0,o1).
Action schema tightfisted(o0, o1, o2): preconditions: hand(o0) and sneeze(o1) and texture(o2) and next(o1,o2) and vase(o0,o1); add effects: next(o0,o2); delete effects: vase(o0,o1).

Instance A initial facts: cats(object_0), collect(object_10,object_2), collect(object_5,object_1), collect(object_6,object_1), collect(object_7,object_1), collect(object_8,object_2), collect(object_9,object_2), hand(object_11), next(object_0,object_5), next(object_11,object_8), next(object_3,object_5), next(object_4,object_10), sneeze(object_3), sneeze(object_4), spring(object_5), spring(object_8), stupendous(object_1), stupendous(object_2), texture(object_10), texture(object_5), texture(object_6), texture(object_7), texture(object_8), texture(object_9).

Instance A proposed plan (ordered): wretched(object_4,object_10,object_8,object_2), clip(object_11,object_4,object_8), wretched(object_4,object_8,object_9,object_2), tightfisted(object_11,object_4,object_9).

Instance B initial facts: cats(object_0), cats(object_1), collect(object_10,object_3), collect(object_11,object_3), collect(object_6,object_2), collect(object_7,object_2), collect(object_8,object_2), collect(object_9,object_3), hand(object_12), next(object_0,object_6), next(object_1,object_9), next(object_12,object_10), next(object_4,object_7), next(object_5,object_9), sneeze(object_4), sneeze(object_5), spring(object_6), spring(object_9), stupendous(object_2), stupendous(object_3), texture(object_10), texture(object_11), texture(object_6), texture(object_7), texture(object_8), texture(object_9).

curate.system_prompt: You are a domain analyst who converts informal action descriptions into a clear, normalized schema without producing PDDL; extract predicates, parameters, preconditions, and add/delete effects, keep all names lowercase, and list all referenced objects.
curate.prompt: Your name is spec_curator; using only the public information {environment->public_information} and your private guidance {agents->spec_curator->private_information}, produce a normalized domain specification (not PDDL) that lists predicates, action signatures with parameters, and for each action its preconditions, add effects, and delete effects; also enumerate the referenced object symbols; do not invent facts or objects and do not output PDDL.

extract.system_prompt: You extract structured instance data from text without producing PDDL; include the object set, full init facts, goal, and the ordered plan provided.
extract.prompt: Your name is instance_A_analyst; from the public information {environment->public_information} and your private guidance {agents->instance_A_analyst->private_information}, extract Instance A as: objects list, init facts list, goal, and the ordered plan as given; keep all predicate and object names lowercase and do not output PDDL.

extract.system_prompt: You extract structured instance data from text without producing PDDL; include the object set, full init facts, and the goal.
extract.prompt: Your name is instance_B_analyst; from the public information {environment->public_information} and your private guidance {agents->instance_B_analyst->private_information}, extract Instance B as: objects list, init facts list, and the goal; keep all predicate and object names lowercase and do not output PDDL or propose a plan.

finalize_pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL and the Fast Downward solver; integrate inputs to produce one PDDL domain and PDDL problem files compatible with Fast Downward; use lowercase names, :strips requirements, and only predicates; enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and each problem between <problem></problem>.
finalize_pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator; integrate the normalized domain {domain_spec} with the extracted instances {instance_A_data} and {instance_B_data} to produce a final, solver-ready PDDL domain and two PDDL problem files (one for Instance A and one for Instance B) targeting Fast Downward; ensure action schemas match the normalized domain, include all referenced objects in each problem, reproduce all init facts and the goal verbatim, and enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and each problem between <problem></problem> tags.
